ossj.common
Interface StringMultiValueList

All Superinterfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable, javax.oss.MultiValueList, java.io.Serializable

public interface StringMultiValueList
extends javax.oss.MultiValueList

March 2005

1.1
Author:
OSS through Java Initiative, Vincent Perrot Sun Microsystems Inc.

 java.lang.String[] make(int number)
          The list is a factory for its elements
 void remove(java.lang.String[] attributes)
          removes the attributes from the existing list (uses equals method of attribute to test for equality) The attribute not present in the system list are ignored.
 void set(java.lang.String[] attributes)
          resets the whole existing array with the provided one.

Method Detail

setModifier

void setModifier(int val)
Set the modifer. Valid values are MultiValueList.NONE MultiValueList.SET MultiValueList.ADD MultiValueList.REMOVE else the modifier is set to MultiValueList.NONE

Parameters:
val - the modifer role

add

void add(java.lang.String[] attributes)
         throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
adds the attrs to the existing list

Parameters:
the - array of String to add
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - in case the given attributes is null
java.lang.IllegalStateException

remove

void remove(java.lang.String[] attributes)
            throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                   java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
removes the attributes from the existing list (uses equals method of attribute to test for equality) The attribute not present in the system list are ignored.

Parameters:
the - array of String to remove
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - in case the given attributes is null
java.lang.IllegalStateException

set

void set(java.lang.String[] attributes)
         throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
resets the whole existing array with the provided one.

Parameters:
the - new array of String to set
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - in case the given attributes is null
java.lang.IllegalStateException

get

java.lang.String[] get()
                       throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
returns the array of values. This is just an accessor for the MultiValue array attribute, it does not do a "get" from the back end. If none of the add, set, or remove methods have been called then there is nothing to get, so throw an IllegalStateException.

Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - the modifier is position to MultiValueList.NONE

make

java.lang.String[] make(int number)
                        throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
The list is a factory for its elements

Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - in case the given number is greate than 1024

equals

boolean equals(java.lang.Object arg)
Checks whether two StringMultiValueList are equal. The result is true if and only if the argument is not null and is an StringMultiValueList object that has the arguments.

Overrides:
equals in class java.lang.Object
Parameters:
value - the Object to compare with this StringMultiValueList
Returns:
if the objects are equal; false otherwise.
